revised_title: Three-Dimensional Turbulence and Evaporation in the Lower Atmosphere
tldr: The article investigates three-dimensional turbulence and evaporation in the lower atmosphere, introducing a hypothetical three-dimensional diffusive system for use in evaporation problems. The theoretical computation of the vapor distribution over a parabolic area is repeated using a new value for the constant, evaluated by analogy with the form taken up by the corresponding coefficient in Calder's development. The results show a good comparison with experimental values, improving on previous two-dimensional theories.
